definition-item.definition-title: PERMANENT WAY; PERMANENT-WAY TOOLS; MACHINES FOR MAKING RAILWAYS OF ALL KINDS (derailing or rerailing blocks on track, track brakes or retarders B61K)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Structure of stationary tracks on which propelled vehicles run for the transportation of passengers or freights;
Tools and machines specially designed for making, maintaining, renewing or taking-up the track.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Track brakes fixed to permanent way
Devices along the track for guiding or ensuring the safety of railway traffic
Removing undesirable matter from the permanent way (cleaning)

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

special-meanings.paragraph-text: In patent documents, the following words/expressions are often used with the meaning indicated:

definition-item.definition-title: Ballastway; Other means for supporting the sleepers or the track; Drainage of the ballastway (draining by trenches, culverts, or conduits E01F5/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Continuous load bearing bedding for supporting the sleepers or the track, e.g. ballast or concrete slab;
Drainage of the ballastway or the ballastless bedding
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Slabs as such for supporting the rails
Placing, working or taking-up the ballast
Making of concrete parts of the track in situ
Means for temporarily supporting the sleeper or the track
Draining the sub-base of railways by trenches, culverts or conduits

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: General structure of permanent way (railway networks B61B1/00; foundations for pavings E01C3/00; foundations in general E02D)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
General structure of the track, e.g. on bridges or in tunnels, foundations for the track.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Track superstructure adapted for tramways in paved streets
Tracks for special kinds of railways
General arrangements of stations, e.g. platforms

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Transverse or longitudinal sleepers (for switches or crossings E01B7/22); Other means resting directly on the ballastway for supporting rails

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Sleepers and other means for supporting rails, e.g. concrete slabs, regardless of the substructure, the sleepers being parallel or orthogonal to the rails.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Sleepers for shiftable tracks for heavy loads

definition-item.definition-title: Rails; Guard rails (manufacture of rails B21B); Distance-keeping means for them

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Rails for carrying vehicles with their centre of gravity above or suspended from the rail; guard rails, guide rails to prevent derailing; distance keeping means.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Rail parts for switches or crossings
Rail anchors preventing shifting of the track
Laying, re-building or taking-up the rails
Working rails in or on the line

definition-item.definition-title: Switches; Crossings (operating mechanisms B61L)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Mechanical installation enabling trains to be guided from one track to another at a railway junction; crossing of tracks.
This place does not cover:
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Switches for special kinds of railways

definition-item.definition-title: Fastening rails on sleepers, or the like (fastening rails to bridges E01D19/12)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Fastening means and other track components, e.g. tie-plates, sole-plates, pads or the like, used for attaching rails on their support.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Fastening switches or crossings on special sleepers
Apparatus for fixing or removing fastening means or track components

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Fastening rails, tie-plates, or chairs directly on sleepers or foundations; Means therefor

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Means for fastening rails directly on sleepers or foundations, even if the rails rest on sole-plates or pads;
Means for fastening tie plates or chairs directly on sleepers or foundations.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Fastening the rail on the tie-plate
Fastening the rail in the chair

definition-item.definition-title: Rail joints (electrical connection of the rail B60M5/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Dismountable or non-dismountable rail joints, e.g. by using fishplates or made by welding.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Undetachably joining in or on the track, e.g. welding

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Arrangements preventing shifting of the track

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Arrangements, e.g. rail anchors, preventing shifting such as longitudinal rail movement, which typically occurs during acceleration or deceleration of vehicles, or during expansion and contraction due to temperature change.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Machines or devices for shifting tracks

definition-item.definition-title: Guards for preventing a person's foot being trapped in grooved rails

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Arrangements to avoid a person's foot to get stuck in the gap formed along a rail by grooved rails.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Safety means (in general) for rail/road crossing traffic

definition-item.definition-title: Cattle guards connected to the permanent way (grids in general for preventing cattle from straying A01K3/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Arrangements connected to the installations of the railroad preventing cattle or cattle-like animals (whether domesticated or not), such as horses, sheep or deer, from straying on or walking along railways, or preventing intrusion in tunnels.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Grids in general for preventing for preventing cattle from straying
Guards or obstacles for preventing access to the route

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Means for fixing fences or the like to rails

definition-item.definition-title: Protection of permanent way against development of dust or against the effect of wind, sun, frost, or corrosion; Means to reduce development of noise (snow fences E01F7/02, snow-ploughs E01H8/02, watering E01H11/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Protective means of the permanent way against weather influences incorporated in the track;
Means for protecting the underground against spillage;
Means to reduce noise incorporated in the track
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Control of undesirable vegetation on permanent ways of railways

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Spillage retaining means for large containers
Protection against snow, sand wind or falling rocks in general
Noise absorbing or reflecting arrangements for railways
Removing snow or ice from roads

definition-item.definition-title: Track superstructure adapted for tramways in paved streets (paving E01C9/04, E01C9/06)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Embedded rail systems, where the traffic area of rail vehicles needs to be shared with road users of private transport, such as cars, trucks or bikes and pedestrians.
This place does not cover:
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Easily dismountable or movable tracks, e.g. temporary railways; Details specially adapted therefor

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Light railways such as field, colliery or mine use, temporary railways, as well as shiftable tracks for heavy loads.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Runway or tracks for trolleys or cranes
Rails of supporting structures for mobile scaffolds provided on roofs

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Propelled stands or trestles, e.g. on tracks, as supports for apparatus placed thereon

definition-item.definition-title: Tracks for special kinds of railways (systems B61B; wheel tracks on roads E01C9/02)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Special kinds such as rack railways, mono rails, cable-drawn, stationary aerial rope, supporting rails for suspended vehicles, tracks for guiding vehicles, magnetic suspension.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Overhead rail system for handicapped persons
Suspended load carriers movable by hand or gravity

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Rope railway systems using cables as traction means
Not vehicle mounted steering control for guiding road vehicles, e.g. in urban networks.

definition-item.definition-title: Placing, renewing, working, cleaning, or taking-up the ballast, with or without concurrent work on the track; Devices therefor; Packing sleepers

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Placing, redistributing, levelling, loosening the ballast; removing or taking-up ballast; renewing or cleaning the ballast in situ, with or without taking-up or lifting the track; compacting the ballast with or without introducing additional fresh material under the sleepers.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: General body details of railway vehicles, e.g. working platform
Removing undesirable matter from the permanent way

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Locally compacting the ballast in the vicinity of the sleepers

definition-item.definition-title: Laying, rebuilding, or taking-up tracks; Tools or machines therefor (E01B27/00, E01B31/00 take precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Transporting, laying, removing or renewing rails, sleepers or lengths of assembled track;
Lifting or levelling of tracks; installing or removing fastening means or other track components, e.g. rail clips, sole-plates;
Undetachably joining or fastening track components in or on the track, e.g. by welding; Sealing rail joints.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Hand held nailing or stapling tools
Devices for moving or tilting heavy loads

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

definition-item.definition-title: Working rails, sleepers, baseplates, or the like, in or on the line; Machines, tools, or auxiliary devices specially designed therefor (characterised by features independent of use on assembled track B21, B23 - B25, B27)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Working such as reconditioning, repairing or treating track components in or on the line and machines specially designed therefor.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Laying, rebuilding or taking up tracks or track components
Undetachably joining or fastening track components

definition-item.definition-title: Machines or devices for shifting tracks, with or without lifting, e.g. for aligning track, for shifting excavator track (combined with sleeper packing machines E01B27/17)

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Machines combined with sleeper packing machines

definition-item.definition-title: Applications of measuring apparatus or devices for track-building purposes (apparatus on locomotives or cars to indicate or record bad track sections B61K9/00; measuring angles, linear dimensions, or irregularities in general G01B, G01C)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Measuring for track building, maintaining or renewing purposes.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Apparatus on locomotives or cars to indicate or record bad track sections
Devices along the track for guiding or ensuring the safety of railway traffic

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Measuring angles, linear dimensions, or irregularities in general
